WRITING.TEXT: A lot of people forget just how powerful the entry level benzos are. Even the baby benzo -valium can help you a great deal, before you resort to xanax, clonazepam and other stuff. I've tried a good deal of them but the Valium I'm prescribed at the moment is really good. It won't turn you into a zombie but it will take the edge off some pretty nasty feelings.
Diazepam. Just got 100 10 mg tabs prescribed. Should do me for a couple of months.
I don't even drink the shit. It's so overrated, it's not funny.

Looks pretty good to me.

No mods. I killed the griffin - am I to notify whomever posted the contract? If so, I have not done that. That could be my downfall.
Yes, I have tried meditating for various amounts of time. Yes, I have talked to some other NPCs (didn't really think much of it). No, I have not attempted to reinstall the game. I really hope I don't have to do that.
Thanks for your input. My next move will be to notify the contract giver. I'm starting to think that may be the issue.
Thanks again for bearing with me. I was pretty pissed off when I wrote that post!

Disagree. Yeah, it hurts but you know it's not actually harmful. I'd rather not give them the satisfaction of seeing me jump around and scream blue murder. You know it will pass. The worst bit is not being able to see.
It's not that bad, FFS. Jesus, don't acknowledge they've hurt you. The worst bit is not being able to see properly.

Fentanyl is just as safe as heroin, IF and only IF the dose is known and controlled. Don't forget, a staggering number of people have died, just using heroin alone - they buy some and expect it to be just as strong as it was before but it's 'too pure' and the overdose. That's no different to a fentanyl overdose - it's the wildly varying purity of their chosen drug that is the real problem. Not the drug, itself.
You don't know much about addiction, do you?

Another poster said that they are testing the equipment that was used by these overdose victims. They may have used more than one drug - meaning that they could have used the same gear to prepare both heroin (or what they thought was heroin) and cocaine.
So that puts doubt on the claim that cocaine is being cut with fentanyl. And it makes sense - if you take cocaine and it makes you anything else but 'up', you would be pretty pissed off.

It's not that they want to kill people - it's easier to smuggle that shit across borders. Would you rather try and get a tiny amount of fentanyl past the authorities or many times that amount of heroin or similar?
You smuggle the fentanyl across in much smaller quantities, then cut he shit out of it to bulk it up. Or use it to fortify the heroin you already have.
They fuck up the dosing - you get hot spots in the batch and that's why people die. It's very, very difficult to blend powders accurately, if you do not have the right equipment. It's a very common problem in engineering - especially when you have powders where the particles are of different size and/or density.
Isn't China White a form that is already a salt that dissolves easily in the blood - you don't have to mix it with lemon juice or some other acid, as compared to some of the brown heroin types?
You look like you eat babies.
I can piss it in half. Is that enough?
Like your neck?
How so?
What do you mean? I killed the thing already. She won't talk to me to take the acid gland.

Just patiently waiting for something better. Reddit admins suck. The mods of most major subs suck. A lot of things suck about reddit. It might be the best out of a bad lot right now, but I long to see its demise.
Surround sound, in general. It's just not that good.

WRITING.TITLE: What is a 'yardstick mine'?
WRITING.TEXT:
Saw some pawn show where a guy had a training set for US soldiers, containing inert Japanese mines. At one point, the term 'yardstick mine' was used but I didn't see what it was. Can't find any decent pics or info online.
Anyone know what it is?

"Fire does not contain water". Wrong in almost every common setting. Burn something with hydrogen in it (like hydrocarbons, wood, etc.) and you get water in almost every situation.
''Microwaves work by heating water". Patently wrong in the sense that water is the only thing being heated. Microwaves are not limited to heating water only. Far from it.
Thanks.

Buzzword?

Balance the equation:
Ca + 2HCl -- CaCl2 + H2
The ratio of Ca to H2 is 1:1. So, you need as many moles of Ca as you get H2. Use the ideal gas law to calculate how many moles of H2 in 8.32 L.
Assume HCl is in excess. It should be just under 0.3 moles of H2, as one mole of any gas at STP occupies 22.4 L
So you have PV = nRT at (I am assuming standard conditions) 1 atm and 273.15 K. You need to choose which value of R to use - Since the question is in litres and atmospheres, select the appropriate value:
P = 1 atm, V = 8.32 L, T = 273.15 K, R = 0.08205 L.atm/mol.K, n = ?
Solve for n and you have the amount of H2 produced in moles. Because the ratio is 1:1, you know how many moles of Ca were needed, in the first place.
Use the molecular weight of Ca to determine the mass needed. It will be something close to 0.3 x mol. weight of Ca.
Thanks mate.
Top shelf.
Exactly. Extremely poor thermal efficiency.

Either a TAG-Porsche turbo McLaren or the Lotus-Honda 99T at Adelaide. Two of the most iconic cars for me. Beautiful livery and turbocharged power. Back when drivers actually used a clutch and a manual gearbox. You had to manage fuel, exhaust gas temperature and make sure each turbo was matched to the other in real time. There was a lot to do in those cockpits. Not saying there isn't now but I will always be nostalgic for the 80s turbos.
No one forces you to stand there.

The turbopumps were able to supply fuel at 58,560 litres per minute and oxidiser at 93,920 litres per minute. The turbopumps themselves each required 55,000 brake horsepower.
Per engine.

WRITING.TITLE: WTF is in dishwasher tablets that allows them to clean such heavily encrusted stuff at only a fairly low temperature?
WRITING.TEXT: My dishwasher only goes to 60 C. Not a high temp. What is in the tablets or liquids that is able to get rid of even the most dirty, crusty, caked on food? It never fails to get rid of every single bit.
Tattoos.
None. Why would you watch a movie 10 times?
Root cause.
Can I please not tune that PID loop?
Are you talking to the right person??

And pH 1.5 is pissweak. HCl can have a concentration of 12 M or something like that. The pH is fucking negative. Just like I have said our stomach acid is a strong acid by definition but the concentration/pH is weak as piss.
Esomeprazole.
Well, it's hardly porn, is it? Looks like an unfinished project - because it is.
Perhaps you could do better.
Your point?

Yes, it does. Your 0.1 M "concentrated" solution pales in comparison to the maximum. Therefore, the 12 M solution is way more concentrated - and it's also the maximum concentration for normal conditions.
We're talking about stomach acid, here. It is NOT concentrated either by definition or in practice. It doesn't cause lasting injuries from contact with the mucous membranes, does it? No, that's why I made the point. Why are you insisting on nitpicking?
No. HCl is a strong acid by definition. Stomach acid is 0.05 - 0.1 M in concentration. HCl can be far, far more concentrated than that - something like ~12 M (pH -1.1). Big, big difference.
Where are you talking about, FFS?
Reverberating?
Gastro-oesophageal reflux disease is what it's called where I'm from.
Absolutely no idea.
Can I check out your...
Pfft. Doesn't do much for ya when you're 5'6''! I remain hopeful...
Rock out with yer cock out.
Fuckin' jesus. That shit is suitable for chemical warfare, without even exaggerating. Get a crop duster to sprinkle that over a town. The results would be horrendous.

No. It's NOT very concentrated. pH is really irrelevant here. Stomach acid is only about 0.05 - 0.1 molar. That is nothing in the scheme of things. And a pH of 1.5 isn't really that bad. pH can go a fuckload lower than that.
It's not giant, though...
Fuckin' hate when that happens.
